intro: Plectronia dicocca, commonly known as the two-seed fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruit is a small, round, greenish fig that ripens to a yellowish color. The fruit contains two seeds, which is reflected in its common name. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
